meanings.definition: The art of creating decorative designs using rolled strips of paper.
meanings.sent1: She learned quilling in art class and made a beautiful flower design.
meanings.sent2: The quilling on the greeting card added a lovely touch to the message.
meanings.sent3: The quilling expert accidentally rolled up her shopping list instead of paper.
meanings.sent4: Her quilling skills were like a magic wand, turning plain paper into intricate patterns.
meanings.sent5: The quilling workshop was a colorful whirlwind of creativity.

meanings.definition: A piece of paper that has been rolled and shaped into a decorative design.
meanings.sent1: She carefully placed the quilling on the scrapbook page to enhance its beauty.
meanings.sent2: The quilling resembled delicate lace when placed on the table.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat batted the quilling off the table, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The quilling looked like a tiny scroll of ancient writing, unraveling its secrets.
meanings.sent5: Each quilling piece was a miniature masterpiece of precision and artistry.

meanings.definition: The act of rolling and shaping paper into decorative designs.
meanings.sent1: Her quilling of the paper strips was a soothing and meditative process.
meanings.sent2: The quilling of the edges gave the artwork a unique texture.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried quilling acorns into tiny paper shapes.
meanings.sent4: The quilling of the paper transformed it from flat to three-dimensional art.
meanings.sent5: The quilling demonstration showcased the intricate techniques of the craft.
